column4: Hey everyone, I'm trying to run "vlc -I http" on a proxmox OpenVZ ubuntu. The rest is on a pastebin (http://pastie.org/3976076) to not flood the channel
Hey everyone, I'm trying to run "vlc -I http" on a proxmox OpenVZ ubuntu. The rest is on a pastebin (http://pastie.org/3976076) to not flood the channel
use vlc-nox
or cvlc
: vlc-nox & cvlc is just "sli" editions of vlc?
: and are they cabeble of http interface?
yes
: okay thanks alot! I will go google that :)
: maybe i haven't been look that much into it, but when i run "cvlc -I http" i get the exact same error
: maybe i haven't been look that much into it, but when i run "cvlc -I http" i get the exact same error
it should work, try updating vlc via ppa
also which version of Ubuntu server  you use, because use use very old version of vlc currently it is VLC  2.0.1 Twoflower
: root@VLC:~# uname -a Linux VLC 2.6.32-11-pve #1 SMP Wed Apr 11 07:17:05 CEST 2012 i686 GNU/Linux
: Proxmox template used: ubuntu-10.04-standard_10.04-4_i386.tar.gz
: VLC version 1.0.6 Goldeneye
Update vlc and it will work see this ppa https://launchpad.net/~videolan/+archive/master-daily
thatnks i'll try
: I get "Failed to fetch http://ppa.launchpad.net/videolan/master-daily/ubuntu/dists/lucid/main/binary-i386/Packages.gz" when trying to do: "apt-get update" after adding ppa
sudo add-apt-repository ppa:n-muench/vlc
: Still get "Failed to fetch http://ppa.launchpad.net/videolan/master-daily/ubuntu/dists/lucid/main/binary-i386/Packages.gz" vlc --version still says: VLC media player 1.0.6 Goldeneye
sudo  add-apt-repository ppa:videolan/master-daily -r
-r is not reginized
: rm /etc/apt/sources.list.d/videolan-stable-daily*
